title: Oniba’s wife was shot thrice, by kidnappers, witness tells court - Vanguard News
text:
Home » News » Oniba’s wife was shot thrice, by kidnappers, witness tells court Oniba’s wife was shot thrice, by kidnappers, witness tells court On 6:29 am In News by Tony Comments 
By Onozure Dania 
A consultant surgeon from the Lagos State University Teaching Hospital, Dr Grace Eke yesterday told an Igbosere High Court in Lagos, that the wife of the traditional ruler of Iba Town Lagos was shot thrice, by the kidnappers of the monarch. 
Eke who is the sixth prosecution witness in the ongoing trial of four men accused by the police of kidnapping the traditional ruler, said that the monarch’s wife, Olori Abosede Oseni, suffered four gunshot wounds from at least three bullets. 
The Olori’s husband, Oba Goriola Oseni, was kidnapped from his palace at Iba on July 16, 2016. 
The defendants who allegedly kidnapped the monarch are Duba Furejo, Ododowo Isaiah, Reuben Anthony and Yerin Fresh. 
The Lagos state prosecuting counsel, Adeniji Kazeem, who is the Attorney General and Commissioner of Justice had also alleged that the defendants murdered a security guard, Sunday Eniola Okanlawon, a commercial motorcyclist, Joseph Okeke and also robbed the Olori of her mobile phone before shooting her several times. 
At the resumed hearing of the matter yesterday, Mr Jide Martins, an Assistant Director of Public Prosecution, introduced Eke as the sixth prosecution witness. 
Eke told Justice Oluwatoyin Taiwo that her team, including several surgeons and other doctors, saw the Olori for the first time in the early hours of July 17, 2016, suffering from life-threatening gunshot wounds. 
“She was pale, restless and in shock. She had lost a lot of blood from her wounds, her blood pressure was low and she was very drowsy,” Ekeh said. 
According to her, the wound was likely caused by a penetrating bullet and two operations were carried out on the patient. Tony
